channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.
channel.copyright: Copyright:(C) Sun, 27 Oct 2024 04:34:53 IST Bennett Coleman & Co. Ltd, http://in.indiatimes.com/policyterms/1554651.cms

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: Photo of Kamala Harris in McDonald's dress going viral. Is it real?
item.description: ​McDonald's said it is true that no records of Harris' employment exist but this is not an aberration and not a reason to think that she didn't work at a McDonald's. "Though we are not a political brand, we’ve been proud to hear former President Trump’s love for McDonald’s and Vice President Harris’s fond memories working under the Arches. While we and our franchisees don’t have records for all positions dating back to the early ’80s, what makes ‘1 in 8’ so powerful is the shared experience so many Americans have had."
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Amber Rose says Beyonce's Kamala Harris speech is copied. Social media users ask 'Who are you?'
item.description: ​Amber Rose stirred a social media frenzy after she claimed the Beyonce's speech for Kamala Harris on Friday was copied from the speech that Amber Rose gave for Donald Trump at the Republican National Convention. "She wanna be me so bad. Literally took my whole speech," Amber Rose's comment went viral with people questioning why Beyonce would even try to copy Amber Rose. Social media users also questioned who Amber Rose is and who on earth wants to be Amber Rose.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: World leaders call for de-escalation
item.description: The US, Britain, and the EU call for de-escalation as Israel hits military targets across Iran in retaliatory strikes. UN chief Antonio Guterres urges an end to the conflict. Israel's actions were described as self-defense, while Russia and various Muslim countries condemned the strikes and warned of further escalation in the Middle East.

item.title: Jamaat backs calls for Bangladesh president's resignation
item.description: Demands for the Bangladesh president's resignation are growing, as key organizations like the Anti-Discrimination Student Movement and Jatiya Nagorik Committee met with senior BNP leaders. They also discussed the idea of a 'second republic,' proposed by Jamaat, aiming to build political consensus on these issues. BNP will evaluate the demands within their party forum.

item.title: US approves $2 billion in arms sales to Taiwan
item.description: The US approved a $2 billion arms sale to Taiwan, including advanced surface-to-air missile systems, amid rising tensions with China. Taiwan's president thanked the US, citing the need for stronger self-defense capabilities. The sales include NASAMS and radar systems to bolster Taiwan's military.

item.title: Ukraine invasion biggest threat to world peace: Olaf Scholz
item.description: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz emphasized the importance of maintaining existing borders and condemned aggression, referring to the Russia-Ukraine conflict as the greatest current threat to international peace. During his three-day visit to India, Scholz engaged with students at BITS Pilani in Goa and highlighted the significance of safe seas and freedom of navigation.

item.title: End of road for Chinese investors in Bordeaux wine
item.description: Many Chinese investors are selling their Bordeaux wine estates due to capital controls in China, declining Asian demand, and underestimated operating costs. Iconic properties, including Chateau Latour Laguens, are hitting the auction block at low prices. Chinese investment in Bordeaux once fueled by dreams of luxury living and high returns, now faces major setbacks.

item.title: Are Musk & Russian President Putin talking?
item.description: Elon Musk has been in regular contact with Russian President Vladimir Putin for the last two years, raising national security concerns due to Musk's government contracts. SpaceX's owner, also a significant supporter of Donald Trump, reportedly discussed various topics, including business and geopolitics, with Putin.

item.title: Tel Aviv's limited attack on Tehran may help foster deal
item.description: Israel's Saturday assault on Iran, in coordination with Washington, targeted missile and air defense sites, aiming to de-escalate tensions in Lebanon and Gaza. The restrained strike followed consultations involving US Secretary of State Antony Blinken. Iran reported four military deaths, while US President Joe Biden noted the precision targeting of military installations.

item.title: Watch: JD Vance said he won't be shocked if Biden votes for Donald Trump
item.description: "He wears Trump hat at the firefighter event. A couple of weeks ago, she (Kamala Harris) was starting one of her big rallies and he (Biden) decides to have a press conference 30 seconds into it. So they're all watching Joe Biden and not Kamala Harris. Or, he'll say something nice here and there about Donald Trump," JD said.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Victoria and David Beckham are irritating to Miami neighbors: 'They are not private'
item.description: David and Victoria Beckham's recent $77 million mansion purchase in Miami Beach causes neighborhood disturbance due to increased media and fan attention. Unlike other celebrities, they used their real names, making their address public. Nearby residents claim that the area has been clogged with inquisitive eyes who turn up to get a glimpse of David and Victoria. And it's it's not difficult. They just look up the address in the phone book.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Amid 'boycott Amazon' trend, Trump meets executives of Bezos-owned Blue Origin
item.description: ​A lot of unconfirmed inside information is floating around after the WaPo announced its decision to not endorse either Kamala Harris or Donald Trump this election.. According to one report, an endorsement of Harris was drafted but was not published as the go-ahead from Bezos was awaited. The decision not to publish that endorsement was made by Bezos alone.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Barron knows all about you': Is Donald Trump obsessed with his 18-year-old son?
item.description: Donald Trump said podcasts, TikTok are a whole new world to him and he is now on TikTok. "Barron knows all about you. He knows guys I have never heard of like Adin Ross. I'd say who are they and he would say they are very big. You gotta do it. He's very smart," Donald Trump said.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Why are Harry and Meghan leading separate lives? Local newspaper says...
item.description: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle have stirred speculation about their relationship, with reports suggesting a potential split as they make more individual appearances. However, conflicting reports of a new vacation home in Portugal add to the confusion. They might either be heading for a divorce, separating professionally, or simply letting rumors circulate while focusing on their careers. After the rumors circulated in the UK, now Montecito Journal in California reported the same.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Donald Trump's ex-wife condemns 'Hitler' jibe: 'This is my daughter's father...'
item.description: ​Former chief of staff of the Trump administration John Kelly criticized the former president and said he fit the dictionary definition of a 'fascist'. He also said Trump used to praise Adolf Hitler. Vice president Kamala Harris cited John Kelly's statement and said it was deeply troubling that Donald Trump would invoke Hitler.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 10 things Donald Trump told Joe Rogan in 3-hour podcast
item.description: Donald Trump said his biggest mistake during his time in the White House was hiring "bad people, or disloyal people". For example, he took the name of John Kelly who recently called Donald Trump a fascist and an admirer of Hitler. Trump said John Kelly is a bully. "I picked some people that I shouldn’t have picked.”
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Epstein talked about Trump all the time': Ex-model who accused Donald of groping her
item.description: Stacy Williams, the former model, who accused Donald Trump of groping her in 1993 in front of Jeffrey Epstein revealed that Epstein berated her after the incident for allowing Donald Trump to touch her breasts, waist and buttocks. She said Epstein used to talk about Donald Trump a lot. "I would say that he talked about having just seen Donald or having just done something, I mean, every time we spoke," Williams said.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Pakistan suicide bombing: Blast near Afghan border claims eight lives, including security officers
item.description: A suicide bomber killed eight people and injured five in an explosion at a checkpoint near Mir Ali, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. This follows a similar attack in Dera Ismail Khan, both incidents highlighting the increased terrorism since the Taliban's resurgence in Afghanistan.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'It nicked right there': Trump shows first assassination attempt scar during Joe Rogan interview
item.description: In a recent interview with Joe Rogan, former President Donald Trump revealed the scar he got from an assassination attempt in July during a campaign rally. Trump, 78, reflected on the dangers of being president, highlighting the media’s role in portraying him negatively. Rogan suggested that inflammatory comparisons contributed to violent actions against Trump.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Trump says Kamala Harris is 'same' as Biden, shares video of similar remarks
item.description: Donald Trump equated Kamala Harris to Joe Biden, sharing a video highlighting their similar language and policy positions. He criticised Harris for attending a dance party with Beyonce. Trump is set to speak at a rally featuring prominent figures like Elon Musk, Mike Johnson, and Tucker Carlson, among others, on Sunday.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
